Blog.post: Ok, so I was dating this guy. Don't think I've mentioned him yet...if so, this is an update. If not, well this will be new. Anyways... I dated this guy, "J", for a year. And almost immediately after our one year anniversary, we called it quits. It was a case of him needing his space type things. But not really. Well... ok, yea we'll call it that. I can't exactly describe my mood after that time. I was feeling so many things. But for right now, I'll just say I was pissed. No. Pissed to the 10th power. *Sidebar* I don't do short term relationships. I'm in it for the long haul. I've been in 2 major relationships prior to this one, both of which lasted for well over a year. One was almost 2 years. Anyway, I am ALL about give and take. I'm ALL about working things out (if at all possible). The way I see it, whenever I get married, that's gonna be it! Don't get it twisted, I will NOT be doing the J.Lo style of marriage. When it happens, it will surely be "until death do us part". *End of Sidebar* Therefore, when J and I broke up, I was pissed. Ugh. So OF COURSE, he has been contacting me lately (by email). I KNEW this would happen! Ugh. Whatever man. I'm nice though, I respond and all. I keep my responses short and sweet. In his last response though, he mentions that "I am the best" and how he's glad that I have "shown him so much". WTF? Ugh! I KNEW this would happen! MEN! Grrrr!!! Man, I can't even get into it right now. It would be the longest blog EVER! Ok, maybe not ever . I will say that he was the first person I dated that just had SO much going on in his life prior to us meeting. Here's a quick rundown: He is divorced, w/ three kids and he's 11 yrs older than me. Yea, just go ahead and let your imagination run wild. It wasn't as bad as it sounds. Well...maybe. Things started to get pretty hairy with him and his ex (who is a Class A Biatch ... and I'm NOT just saying that). He was trying to get sole custody of his children. Oh yea, it was getting u-g-l-y. His ex is/was not having it. Then, on top of all that, he's trying to work two jobs (one full, one part time), find a new full-time job...the list goes on. So I had to call it off. I thought that maybe giving him space for a while would help, but it only made me sad and upset. Soooo, I just said forget it. It was SO hard for me to do that. Like I said, I am in it for the long haul. I believe in working things out and working w/ a person as much as I can. I really loved him (not in love, but definitely loved him). But sometimes, you just gotta let people go. If it weren't for his baggage, he and I would definitely be together and it would be SO great! He was a perfect gentleman. He was actually the perfect guy for me: smart, cute, funny, generous, caring, sweet...omg was he a SWEETHEART!!! He did everything for me just because he wanted to. And he didn't even snore!!!! My gosh, do you know how hard it is to find a man that doesn't snore??!! Geez...what more could I ask for. Ok enough of my sad story. I need to write a book.
